Package gdi.game.map

Class MapSprite

java.lang.Object
gdi.game.WorldObject
gdi.game.Drawable
gdi.game.sprite.Sprite
gdi.game.map.MapSprite
All Implemented Interfaces:
gdi.game.DrawableObject, gdi.game.UpdatableObject
Direct Known Subclasses:
WalkingMapSprite
public class MapSprite extends Sprite
This class handles the connection between a regular Sprite (a graphical entity that can move freely over the world) and a MapTile (an entity representing one tile on a map). It extends the Sprite with methods designed to keep track of the MapTile it is currently over and provides a mechanism to draw the Sprite in relation to a MapTileAsset that put on a MapTile.

This class is especially useful when you need to get notified that a sprite entered or left a certain tile. You can override didEnterTile(MapTile) and willLeaveTile(MapTile) to handle those notifications.
Version:
1.0
Author:
frank
See Also:
  • didEnterTile(MapTile)

    • MapSprite

      public MapSprite(double x, double y, MapWorld w)
      Creates a new Sprite at a given location in the passed world.
      Parameters:
      x - Abscissa in the 2D-Coordinate space of the world (position along the horizontal axis with 0 on the outermost left edge)
      y - Ordinate in the 2D-Coordinate space of the world (position along the vertical axis with 0 on the topmost edge with values growing towards the bottom)
      w - The world you want to use the sprite in

    • MapSprite

      public MapSprite(double x, double y, double angle, MapWorld w)
      Creates a new Sprite at a given location in the passed world.
      Parameters:
      x - Abscissa in the 2D-Coordinate space of the world (position along the horizontal axis with 0 on the outermost left edge)
      y - Ordinate in the 2D-Coordinate space of the world (position along the vertical axis with 0 on the topmost edge with values growing towards the bottom)
      angle - The rotation of the sprite in degrees
      w - The world you want to use the sprite in

  • Method Details

    • didAddToWorld

      public void didAddToWorld(gdi.game.sprite.AbstractSpriteWorld w)
      This hook is called when the Sprite is added to the world. When the sprite is created it is only associated with the passed world but not assigned to it. This is useful when preloading lots of objects that need to be shown right away but at some later point in time.. This implementation will make sure that the sprite is added to the correct tile on creation.
      Overrides:
      didAddToWorld in class Sprite
      Parameters:
      w - The world the sprite was added to. This is always the same world as returned by WorldObject.getWorld().
      See Also:
      • AbstractSpriteWorld.addSprite(Sprite)

    • setLocation

      public void setLocation(gdi.util.math.Vec2D loc)

      Setter for the location of this Sprite in the World. (see Sprite(double, double, AbstractSpriteWorld) for a description of the coordinate space)
      Overrides:
      setLocation in class Sprite
      Parameters:
      loc - A 2D-Vector describing the position of the sprite

    • syncMapTile

      public void syncMapTile()
      Makes sure that the tile returned by this Sprite is in sync with the current location.

    • willRemoveFromWorld

      public void willRemoveFromWorld(gdi.game.sprite.AbstractSpriteWorld w)
      This hook is called when the Sprite is removed from the world. A sprite can be removed from (or added to) its associated world at any time. This is useful when you want to temporarily deactivate or hide a certain sprite.. This implementation will make sure that the sprite is removed from the tile before it is removed from the world
      Overrides:
      willRemoveFromWorld in class Sprite
      Parameters:
      w - The world the sprite was removed from. This is always the same world as returned by WorldObject.getWorld().
      See Also:
      • AbstractSpriteWorld.removeSprite(Sprite)

    • convertToTileSpace

      public final Point convertToTileSpace()
      Calculates and returns the location of this sprite in the space of the tile it is currently on.
      Returns:
      null if the sprite is not above any tile or the pixel location in tile-space of this sprite.

    • getMapTile

      public final MapTile getMapTile()
      Returns the MapTile this sprite is currently over.
      Returns:
      The MapTile under the sprite.

    • update

      public final void update(double deltaTime, double time)
      This implementation will handle the tile-tracking. First it will call updateSprite(double, double) to allow you to do some custom state update. When finished we will determin which tile the sprite is currently over.

      The update implementation for Spirtes. This implementation handles all updates needed by animations and constraints. When you override this method, make sure to invoke super. Without it, any AbstractAnimation or Constraint applied to this Sprite will stop working.
      This method will first update all Animations (by calling AbstractAnimation.update(double, double)) followed by update requests to all Constraints (by calling Constraint.updateSprite(double)).
      Specified by:
      update in interface gdi.game.UpdatableObject
      Overrides:
      update in class Sprite
      Parameters:
      deltaTime - The time passed since the last update call
      time - The game time the new update cycle was started at
      See Also:
      • updateSprite(double, double)

    • getSortOrder

      public MapSprite.SortOrder getSortOrder()
      Returns the MapSprite.SortOrder that is used to draw this sprite.
      Returns:

    • collides

      public Sprite collides(int minDistance)
      Checks of the sprite collides with other sprites
      Parameters:
      minDistance - The minimum distance this sprite wants to have to the next sprite
      Returns:
      null if this sprite does not collide, or the first sprite it collides with

    • findFreePosition

      public boolean findFreePosition(int minDistance, boolean animated)
      When called, the sprite will try to move to a position on the tile where no other sprite is located
      Parameters:
      minDistance - The minimum distance this sprite wants to have to the next sprite
      animated - true if you want the sprite to animate the location change using moveTo
      Returns:
      true if a free position was found.
